  "title": "Internal Auditor",
  "description": "JEV Consulting - Our client one of the major players in the Downstream Oil and Gas sector is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Internal Auditor

Job Location:&nbsp;Imo
Employment Type: Full-time

Position Overview


	The Internal Audit Personnel will be responsible for establishing and leading the audit function of the company, providing independent assurance that the organization&#39;s risk management, governance, and internal control processes are operating effectively.
	The ideal candidate will develop and implement audit frameworks, policies, and systems tailored to the peculiarities of fuel retailing, product movement, and cash management.


Key Responsibilities


	Department Setup &amp; Policy Development
	
		Establish the audit department&rsquo;s structure, scope, and reporting procedures.
		Design and implement audit policies, internal control manuals, and reporting templates.
		Define audit processes for stations, depots, logistics, and finance.
	
	
	Risk Assessment &amp; Internal Control
	
		Conduct risk assessments across business operations.
		Identify control gaps and implement corrective control systems.
		Review existing practices for fraud risks, product loss, and unauthorized transactions.
	
	
	Operational Audits
	
		Audit pump sales, meter readings, cash lodgements, and product losses.
		Investigate discrepancies in daily sales reports, tank dips, and depot loading records.
		Perform surprise station audits and cash spot-checks.
	
	
	Financial &amp; Compliance Audits
	
		Verify accuracy of financial records and compliance with statutory regulations.
		Work with Finance on reconciliation of cash/bank transactions, payroll, and statutory deductions.
		Monitor adherence to tax, pension, NHF, NSITF, and other financial obligations.
	
	
	Depot &amp; Logistics Review
	
		Audit product lifting and delivery processes (truck reconciliation, waybills, and depot receipts).
		Track product flow from purchase to final retail sale.
	
	
	Reporting &amp; Advisory
	
		Prepare timely and objective audit reports with findings and recommendations.
		Report unresolved issues and control failures to top management.
		Propose and monitor implementation of corrective actions.
	
	
	Team Development &amp; Training
	
		Recruit and train audit support staff as required.
		Build audit capacity within stations and departments through training and engagement.
	
	


Key Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field (ICAN/ACCA preferred).
	5+ years audit experience, including 2+ years in oil &amp; gas, logistics, or retail.
	Deep understanding of internal control frameworks and Nigerian statutory requirements.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and auditing software.
	High personal integrity, objectivity, and attention to detail.
	Ability to handle sensitive matters with discretion and confidence.
	The preferred candidate should be based in Owerri, Imo state or willing to relocate.


Remuneration


	Competitive commensurate with experience.
	Accommodation may be provided.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@jevconsulting.com.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Job Position: Internal Auditor

Job Location: Imo
Employment Type: Full-time

	The Internal Audit Personnel will be responsible for establishing and leading the audit function of the company, providing independent assurance that the organization's risk management, governance, and internal control processes are operating effectively.
	The ideal candidate will develop and implement audit frameworks, policies, and systems tailored to the peculiarities of fuel retailing, product movement, and cash management.


Key Responsibilities


	Department Setup & Policy Development
	
		Establish the audit department’s structure, scope, and reporting procedures.
		Design and implement audit policies, internal control manuals, and reporting templates.
		Define audit processes for stations, depots, logistics, and finance.
	
	
	Risk Assessment & Internal Control
	
		Conduct risk assessments across business operations.
		Identify control gaps and implement corrective control systems.
		Review existing practices for fraud risks, product loss, and unauthorized transactions.
	
	
	Operational Audits
	
		Audit pump sales, meter readings, cash lodgements, and product losses.
		Investigate discrepancies in daily sales reports, tank dips, and depot loading records.
		Perform surprise station audits and cash spot-checks.
	
	
	Financial & Compliance Audits
	
		Verify accuracy of financial records and compliance with statutory regulations.
		Work with Finance on reconciliation of cash/bank transactions, payroll, and statutory deductions.
		Monitor adherence to tax, pension, NHF, NSITF, and other financial obligations.
	
	
	Depot & Logistics Review
	
		Audit product lifting and delivery processes (truck reconciliation, waybills, and depot receipts).
		Track product flow from purchase to final retail sale.
	
	
	Reporting & Advisory
	
		Prepare timely and objective audit reports with findings and recommendations.
		Report unresolved issues and control failures to top management.
		Propose and monitor implementation of corrective actions.
	
	
	Team Development & Training
	
		Recruit and train audit support staff as required.

Job Location: Magodo, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
Customer Support & Relationship Management:

	Support customers with shipment bookings and prepare necessary documentation (e.g., waybills, receipts).
	Verify package details and ensure accurate entry into the logistics system.

	Escalate complex issues to the supervisor/management for quick resolution.

	Maintain accurate records of customer interactions and transactions.
	Generate daily/weekly reports on customer complaints, resolutions, and satisfaction trends.


Continuous Improvement & Team Support:


	Assist in customer experience initiatives aimed at improving service quality.
	Collaborate with operations, sales, and accounts teams to ensure a seamless customer journey.
	Provide feedback on customer needs and preferences to improve service offerings.


Qualifications


	OND in Business Administration, Mass Communication, Marketing, Logistics, or related field.
	Certification in Customer Service or Call Centre Management is an advantage.
	School certificate holders with excellent communication skills may be considered

	1 – 3 years of experience in customer service, preferably in logistics, courier, or retail sectors.
	Experience handling customer complaints and working in fast-paced service environments.


Skills & Competencies:


	Strong verbal and written communication skills.
	Excellent interpersonal and problem-solving abilities.
	Knowledge of courier/logistics operations (shipping, tracking, delivery processes).
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and customer management systems (CRM).
	Ability to multitask and remain calm under pressure.
	Attention to detail and accuracy in data entry.


Personal Attributes


	Customer-focused with a friendly and professional attitude.
	Patient, empathetic, and a good listener.

	Team player with a positive attitude.

title: Job Openings at Vintano Hotel
content:
Vintano Hotel is a luxurious 5-star hotel located in the heart of Lekki Phase 1, Lagos, Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Public Area Attendant

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Contract Type: Fixed Term Contract
Report to: Housekeeping Manager
Seniority level: Junior

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Public Area Attendant is responsible for maintaining the cleanliness, hygiene, and overall appearance of all public spaces within the Hotel.
	This includes lobbies, lounges, corridors, poolside areas, gym, conference halls, restaurants, stairways, and other designated common areas.
	The role ensures that guests consistently experience a clean, welcoming, and refreshing environment that reflects the hotel’s standard.


Key Responsibilites


	Sweep, mop, vacuum, and polish floors in all public areas.
	Clean glass surfaces, doors, mirrors, and furniture in the lobby, restaurants, and corridors.
	Sanitize and restock public restrooms, ensuring cleanliness and pleasant fragrance at all times.
	Dust and polish furniture, fixtures, and decorative elements across public areas.
	Maintain the cleanliness of the elevators, staircases, and service corridors.
	Clean and maintain outdoor spaces such as the poolside, garden walkways, and smoking zones.
	Report any maintenance or repair issues promptly to the Supervisor or Maintenance Department.
	Respond courteously to guest inquiries and requests while maintaining confidentiality.
	Ensure public areas are guest-ready at all times, especially during peak occupancy or events.
	Assist guests courteously with directions or information when required.
	Follow all safety and sanitation policies as outlined in the hotel’s SOPs.
	Handle cleaning chemicals safely and use PPE (gloves, masks, aprons) as required.
	Report lost and found items immediately to the Housekeeping Office.
	Adhere to waste management and recycling guidelines.
	Liaise with the Front Office, Maintenance, and Security teams to ensure uninterrupted guest experience.
	Support the Banquet and Events teams by maintaining event venues before, during, and after functions.
	Participate in daily briefings and report completion of assigned areas to the supervisor.


Job Requirements
Qualification:


	Minimum of SSCE or equivalent qualification.


Experience:


	1–2 years of experience in a similar role within a reputable hotel or hospitality establishment.


Skills & Attitude:


	Keen attention to detail and cleanliness.
	Good physical stamina and time management.
	Polite, courteous, and service-oriented.
	Team player with a positive attitude.
	Integrity and respect for guest privacy.


What We Offer


	Salary Range: N80,000.00 – N90,000.00 Gross dependent on experience.
	Benefit Package: Staff Meal.


Application Closing Date: 7th November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@vintanohotel.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Application timing (Urgently required).

 

2.) House Keeper
Job Location: Lekki Lagos,
Employment Type: Full-time

 Accommodations:


	Luxurious Rooms: Choose from a range of rooms, including Vintano Classic, Vintano Twin, Vintano Mini Executive, and more
	Amenities: Enjoy amenities like free WiFi, air conditioning, minibars, and Smart TVs in each room


Amenities:


	Spa and Wellness: Enjoy massages, body treatments, and facials at their state-of-the-art spa center
	Fitness Center: Stay active with their fully equipped gym and sauna room
	Swimming Pool: Relax and unwind in their outdoor pool
	Restaurants and Bars: Savor exquisite cuisine from around the world at one of their three restaurants and bars
	Meeting Spaces: Host events and meetings in their stylish meeting rooms with wireless internet access
	Business Center: Get work done at their business center with latest technology


JOB SUMMARY:

The Housekeeper is responsible for the overall cleanliness, orderliness, and presentation of guest rooms and assigned service areas.The role ensures that every guest experiences a spotless, comfortable, and inviting room that reflects the high hospitality standards of the Hotel.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:


	Clean, dust, and polish guest rooms, bathrooms, balconies, and adjoining areas according to hotel standards.
	Make beds, change linens, and replenish guest supplies (toiletries, water, tea/coffee, stationery, etc.).
	Vacuum carpets, mop floors, and clean furniture, mirrors, and fixtures.
	Check room appliances (TV, AC, lamps, minibar, etc.) to ensure they function properly.
	Conduct final room inspection to confirm readiness before guest arrival or after checkout.
	Report maintenance issues (lighting, plumbing, AC, furniture) promptly to the Supervisor or Maintenance team.
	Replenish amenities based on guest preferences or special requests. Adhere strictly to the hotel’s hygiene and safety policies.
	Handle cleaning chemicals safely and use appropriate PPE (gloves, masks, aprons).
	Follow proper waste segregation and disposal procedures.
	Report lost and found items immediately following hotel policy.
	Maintain trolleys, equipment, and storerooms in clean and organized condition.
	Coordinate with the Front Office for room status updates (clean, occupied, vacant, out-of-order).
	Work closely with the Housekeeping Supervisor to ensure daily room targets are achieved.
	Attend pre-shift briefings and communicate any guest feedback or unusual occurrences.


JOB REQUIREMENTS, SKILLS & ATTITUDE:


	Strong attention to detail and cleanliness.
	Positive and courteous guest attitude.
	Time management and multitasking ability.
	Physical stamina and energy to meet daily workload.
	Integrity, reliability, and respect for guest privacy.
	Teamwork and adaptability.
	Proficient in MS Office, MS Excel is an added advantage.


QUALIFICATION:


	Minimum Educational Standard: FSLC, Secondary School cert, or Trade test, OND


EXPERIENCE:


	1–2 years of experience as a Room Attendant or Housekeeper in a reputable hotel or similar environment.


JOB SPECIFICATION:


	Must live within close proximity or ready to relocate.
	Must be Confidential.


Salary

N80, 000.00 – N90, 000.00 Gross Dependent on Experiences
Benefit Package: HMO, Pension, Leave Allowance, Free Lunch
Opportunity for Growth.

Application Closing Date: 7th November, 2025.

Method of Application 

Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@vintanohotel.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Laundry Manager

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Laundry Manager is responsible for overseeing the daily operations of the laundry department to ensure efficient, high-quality, and cost-effective cleaning of all guest linens, uniforms, and hotel fabrics.
	The role ensures that laundry operations meet hygiene standards, company policies, and guest satisfaction expectations while maintaining staff discipline, productivity, and safety.


Responsibilities


	Supervise and coordinate the daily operations of the laundry department.
	Ensure all laundry (guest items, staff uniforms, and hotel linen) is cleaned, pressed, folded, and stored properly.
	Maintain cleanliness, hygiene, and safety standards within the laundry unit.
	Implement efficient laundry processes to minimize wastage of detergents, water, and electricity.
	Lead, train, and motivate the laundry team to deliver excellent service.
	Prepare staff schedules and assign duties to ensure adequate coverage.
	Conduct regular performance reviews and recommend training needs.
	Inspect laundered items for cleanliness, finishing, and damage.
	Ensure prompt handling and delivery of guest laundry requests.
	Monitor fabric care to prevent damage and extend linen/uniform life cycle.
	Maintain accurate records of linens, uniforms, and laundry supplies.
	Ensure proper inventory control, stock issuance, and requisition of supplies.
	Monitor departmental costs, control wastage, and prepare monthly usage reports.
	Ensure laundry machines are properly maintained and serviced.
	Report faults and liaise with the Maintenance Department for timely repairs.
	Train staff on safe handling of laundry equipment and chemicals.
	Enforce adherence to hotel SOPs, health, safety, and hygiene standards.
	Ensure compliance with Nigerian labour laws and hotel policies.
	Handle guest complaints professionally and resolve them promptly.


Requirements


	Minimum of HND / Bachelor’s Degree in Hospitality Management, Business Administration, or related field.
	Experience: 6 - 10 years of experience in laundry operations, with at least 3+ in a supervisory/managerial role.
	Strong knowledge of laundry chemicals, fabrics, and equipment.
	Ability to manage budgets, inventories, and staff.
	Must live within close proximity or be ready to relocate to Lekki and Environs.
	Must be Confidential. 
	Master's or Professional certification in the hospitality Management field is an added advantage.


Benefits


	Salary: N250,000 - N300,000 Monthly Net, depending on Experience.
	Benefit Package: HMO, Pension, Leave Allowance, Free Lunch, Profit Sharing.
	Opportunity For Growth.
	Collaborative Work Environment.


Application Closing Date: 20th October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment.season@outlook.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

4.) Housekeeping Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking an experienced Housekeeper Manager to oversee our housekeeping department in our hotel.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring high standard of cleanliness of our hotel's rooms, public areas, and facilities. etc.
	You will lead a team of housekeepers, provide excellent customer service, and maintain high standards of quality and efficiency.


Responsibilities


	Manage, Supervise and train housekeeping staff to ensure efficient and effective cleaning
	Ensure high standards of cleanliness and maintenance.
	Conduct regular inspections of rooms and public areas.
	Implement and maintain housekeeping procedures.
	Monitor and manage inventory of cleaning supplies and equipment.
	Handle guest complaints and feedback.
	Collaborate with other departments.
	Develop and manage departmental budgets to ensure financial efficiency
	Respond to guest complaints and feedback, ensuring prompt resolution.
	Ensure compliance with safety and health regulations and standards.


Requirements


	Previous experience in housekeeping or hospitality management in a well-structured hotel, Three (3), Four (4) star or Five (5) star Hotels is a must.
	Sound knowledge of Opera Hospitality Software or Hospitality Software Package is a must.
	Strong leadership, time management and communication skills.
	Attention to detail, quality focus and ability to work under pressure.
	Knowledge of housekeeping procedures and standards.
	Outstanding Interpersonal skills and organizational skills.
	Proficient in MS Office, MS Excel and MS PowerPoint.


Job Specification:


	Must live within close proximity or be ready to relocate to Lekki and Environs.
	Must be Confidential.


Salary
N250,000 - N300,000 Monthly. 

Application Closing Date: 20th October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment.season@outlook.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
